Radical 044: 尸

尸

尸舍婆林 (Skt. śiṃśapā-vana; Pali ) n. a śiṃśapā grove. More than one śiṃśapā grove is cited in the Agamas. The śiṃśapā tree may have been a species of Indian rosewood.
Usage: 往詣婆羅婆提婆羅門村北尸舍婆林中止宿
“they went to the brahmin town of Sālavatī and stopped to rest to the north in a śiṃśapā grove.”
cf. DA 7, 23, and 29.
